results.definition: give or assign a resource to a particular person or cause
make it possible through a specific action or lack of action for something to happen
examples: This sealed door won't allow the water come into the basement

results.definition: allow or plan for a certain possibility; concede the truth or validity of something

examples: Mandela was allowed few visitors in prison

results.definition: allow the presence of or allow (an activity) without opposing or prohibiting

examples: I cannot allow you to see your exam

results.definition: allow the other (baseball) team to score

examples: This short story allows of several different interpretations

results.definition: make a possibility or provide opportunity for; permit to be attainable or cause to remain
examples: The evidence allows only one conclusion

results.definition: grant as a discount or in exchange
examples: The camera store owner allowed me $50 on my old camera
